attachments.title: Get Hired!! Recruiter Panel and Networking
attachments.text: Get Hired!! Recruiter Panel and Networking Join us for an evening of networking,  an interactive panel discussion with decision makers in the talent acquisition, and recruiter booths. The event is open to women and men of all professional backgrounds. Recruiter Panel Ginny Cheng, Sr. Recruiting Manager, M&A at Facebook Tai Bethune, Senior Sourcing Recruiter at Amazon Web Services Katrina Georgiou, Recruiting Operations and Program Manager at Redditt Stephanie Fong, Engineering Recruiter at Aerotek Jordan Ricardo, Recruiting Lead at Instrumental Inc. Moderator: Smitha Prabhu, Director, Talent Experience at SAP Recruiter/Vendor Tables Galvanize AlwaysHired The Creative Group ( Robert Half Staffing) For job announcements and career tips, join our Careers and JobSearch FB page. If you are a jobseeker and would like us to share your information with the recruiters, please complete this form To learn about our upcoming career events, join our Meetup Group For updates and to connect with others attending the event, join the Get Hired event page on Facebook If you are interested in participating in our career fair or sharing job openings at your company with our network, please e-mail us at <mailto:info@theexpatwoman.com|info@theexpatwoman.com> Terms of Participation Agreement:  You agree that you are responsible for any accidents or damages that you cause. You also agree to not hold The Expat Woman, or any of the event supporters liable for any loss, damage, injury, or any other unforeseeable incident.  By Participating at the event, you grant The Expat Woman permission to capture photo/video of the event.  By registering for this event, you also consent to receive email communication from The Expat Woman and its programs about events and updates that may interest you. Tickets to this event are non-refundable. If you are unable to attend, you have the option of giving it to a friend or team member to attend in your place.
attachments.fallback: Eventbrite: Get Hired!! Recruiter Panel and Networking

attachments.title: JustAnswer - Jr. Natural Language Programmer
attachments.text: Jr. Natural Language Programmer - The Role: Jr. Natural Language Programmer GUI is obsolete. The world is rushing headlong into speech and text communication with computers and the internet of things. Learn the skill set of the future. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: Assist with development, implementation and enhancement of a natural language chatbot. Work with writers to convert their intended responses to user inputs into ChatScript script.

messages.text:
<!channel> REMINDER: HIRING TALK TODAY!!
*Radius Intelligence Hiring Talk*
*When*: Thurs. 6/8, 2pm-3pm
*Where*: Boardroom
*Who*: Tyler Woodbury, Customer Insights Mathematician, Manager (Galvanize alumni!) 
*What*: Hiring Junior Data Scientists
*About*: Radius is a fast-growing, venture-backed startup in the heart of San Francisco. Radius applies advanced data science to deliver the most accurate, up-to-date, and comprehensive view on 20M+ US companies―from small businesses to the largest enterprises. We build cutting-edge machine learning solutions that help our customers discover markets, acquire customers, and measure performance through an app that’s intuitive, secure, and enterprise-ready.

*Radius Intelligence Hiring Talk*
*When*: Thurs. 6/8, 2pm-3pm
*Where*: Boardroom
*Who*: Tyler Woodbury, Customer Insights Mathematician, Manager (Galvanize alumni!) 
*What*: Hiring Junior Data Scientists
*About*: Radius is a fast-growing, venture-backed startup in the heart of San Francisco. Radius applies advanced data science to deliver the most accurate, up-to-date, and comprehensive view on 20M+ US companies―from small businesses to the largest enterprises. We build cutting-edge machine learning solutions that help our customers discover markets, acquire customers, and measure performance through an app that’s intuitive, secure, and enterprise-ready. (edited)

*Gearing for the startup world: Training to be an all-rounder*
*When*: Friday June 9th at 8:30am
*Where*: Classroom 312
*Who*: Shruti Badhwar, Co-Founder of <http://Commerce.ai|Commerce.ai>
“Trained as a physicist, Shruti loves to design, build and test. At Cambridge, she developed optical elements to generate and manipulate light that would enable the human beings to see beyond the visible spectrum. At IBM Research, she developed machine vision algorithms to process multimodal images. Currently, she is the co-founder of <http://commerce.ai|commerce.ai> leading the development of a SaaS platform powered by natural language processing and machine learning.”
*Abstract*: The expectations from data scientists at startups (with teams of size 4-20) is often very different from that of mid to large size companies. Startups present an exciting opportunity to solve challenging problems and create a direct impact on the company. From the perspective of the data scientist, it is a unique opportunity to learn, grow and become a leader in the field. Very often the demands of the startup require not just a data scientist who is great at crunching numbers, but a person with the initiative and the vision to see the projects end to end. In my talk, I will discuss the key skills that early stage startups lookout for while hiring their first few team members
<!channel> Sign up for 1:1 calls this Friday! <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DhPm1Q__9v4535bH3WGiYskVDZnkYO_0MD-G6-P3Pws/edit>
<!channel> Anyone interested in doing NLP at a stealth startup?

<@U4CAB2MMY> Aw, what a lovely thing for your mother to do! I would not say that is a "largely done" practice, and I'm a bit surprised that it's done at  all! However, not necessarily a red flag - any interesting companies?
my mom is very thoughtful, it's true.

this sounds like a potentially silly question so that's more reason to ask, but my mom occasionally takes pictures of ads in newspapers for data scientists, and i was wondering if people in this industry still largely advertise positions in newspapers and if those advertisements may be a sign about the company... like a red flag

attachments.title: BuildZoom - Data Engineer
attachments.text: BuildZoom is a data company at heart. We ingest vast volumes of construction data to track the work activities of every single license contractor in the United States. On top of this unique data set we deploy algorithms to identify ideal contractors for new projects. As a data engineer, you will work alongside our two founders and VP of Engineering to develop our data pipeline and accelerate BuildZoom's rapid growth. Our technologies include Python, Ruby on Rails, Redis, MySQL, Postgres, Redshift, Elasticsearch, AWS.

attachments.title: Data-Driven Teacher Hiring
attachments.text: About Us Nimble is a data science company using predictive analytics to give every student access to excellent teachers. Our smart applicant tracking tool uses machine learning to help school districts identify the best teacher talent before they make a hire. We are seeking a data scientist/engineer to help design and develop the robust predictive hiring capabilities that will sit at the core of our product.

attachments.title: In-depth introduction to machine learning in 15 hours of expert videos
attachments.text: In January 2014, Stanford University professors Trevor Hastie and Rob Tibshirani (authors of the legendary Elements of Statistical Learning textbook) taught an online course based on their newest textbook, An Introduction to Statistical Learning with Applications in R (ISLR). I found it to be an excellent course in statistical learning...
attachments.fallback: Data School: In-depth introduction to machine learning in 15 hours of expert videos

attachments.title: Scale: API For Human Intelligence
attachments.text: Humans On-Demand. Get high quality results within minutes.

attachments.title: Smarking - Data Solutions Engineer
attachments.text: ABOUT US Smarking is an MIT spin-off based in San Francisco that brings big data to the parking industry. Parking represents enormous and growing market opportunities ($100 billion worldwide) with fascinating technical challenges. Starting as a SaaS company providing data analytics and predictions to parking professionals, Smarking holds ambitious goals for the future. Since launching, Smarking has graduated from Y Combinator, attracted top notch investors, and is growing rapidly. We at Smarking love people who constantly hack, lead, and grow. You will have opportunities to take on major projects and make a big impact on both the Smarking team and the entire parking industry. ABOUT THIS POSITION Data is our bread and butter. Smarking customers rely on accurate and real-time data as the foundation for analyzing, monitoring and optimizing their portfolios. We are a cross-functional team. As a data solutions engineer, you will work closely with Software Engineers, Customer Success Manag

messages.text: <!channel> Attention attention!!! Hiring talk starting in FIVE MINUTES! Get yourselves to the classroom!!!

*Augment Hiring Talk*

*When:* Wed. 5/31 11am-12pm

*Where:* Room 311

*What:* Demoing product and hiring Data Scientists

*About:* Augment applies artificial intelligence to improve the efficiency of enterprise call centers.  Augment’s human-in-the-loop NLP platform supports existing call center staff by automatically suggesting personalized responses, drawing from the best expertise and responses across the organization.  As customers share more information, Augment’s semantic intelligence identifies sales opportunities, and connects them to existing marketing campaigns.  Ultimately, by lowering support costs, enhancing the consumer experience, and transforming contact centers into profit centers, Augment improves business fundamentals while revolutionizing the scale of customer engagement.

*Who:* Matt Swanson, CEO
Hey <@U4CAB2MMY> ! Was just about to send out details:

attachments.title: Get Hired! Speed Mentoring with Recruiters and Hiring Managers
attachments.text: Are you looking for a job or looking to transition into a new career? Would you like to get tips and advice to help you land your dream job? Join us for our Speed Mentoring event where you will get face time and job search advice from recruiters, hiring managers and career counselors  The evening will start with short presentations by each mentor followed by the speed mentoring. Jobseekers will then meet recruiters,hiring managers and career counselors in a group mentoring format,  asking questions and advice about your job search and making valuable connections.  The groups will switch every 10 minutes This event is open to women and men of all professional backgrounds. Mentors Heidi Smith, Sr. Recruiter of Sales, Professional Services & Security Professionals at Splunk Smitha Prabhu, Director, Talent Experience at SAP Gabriel Moncayo, CEO & Co-Founder of AlwaysHired Meg Escobar, People Operations at Pillow Homes Sara Lager, Manager, Direct Hire at DeWinter Group PK Phommachanh, Lead Associate at Blueprint Search Partners Selina Ngo, Staffing Manager at Randstad Technologies Jordan Helsloot, Technical Recruiter at Randstad Technologies Erica Schneider, Client Services Director at Robert Half Staffing and Recruiting Stephanie Bennett, Division Director HR Services at Robert Half Staffing and Recruiting Recruiter/Vendor Tables Galvanize AlwaysHired Dress code: Business casual or dress for the type of the job you are interested in being hired for. Light refreshments will be served  Thank you to our Sponsors Galvanize Galvanize is where you can become a developer, data scientist, or build your tech startup. Join the conversation and connect with other guests prior to the event! Here are several ways you can connect with other guests prior to the event, so you don't have to walk into a room full of strangers Use the hash tag #tewcareers for updates and to connect with the event attendees and/or get updates and connect with other attendees on the event page on FB Terms of Participation Agreement You agree that you are responsible for any accidents or damages that you cause. You also agree to not hold The Expat Woman, or any of the event supporters liable for any loss, damage, injury, or any other unforeseeable incident. By Participating at the event, you grant The Expat Woman permission to capture photo/video of the event. By registering for this event, you also consent to receive email communication from The Expat Woman and its programs about events and updates that may interest you. Tickets to this event are non-refundable. If you are unable to attend, you have the option of giving it to a friend or team member to attend in your place.
attachments.fallback: Eventbrite: Get Hired! Speed Mentoring with Recruiters and Hiring Managers

messages.text:
<!channel> Hello, everyone! Congrats on capstones so far, and I hope you're all looking forward to presenting tomorrow. I wanted to send out a reminder that on *Friday this week* we are having *Careers Kickoff Day*. This is a full day - please schedule in the class ready to go from 9:30 am - until 5:30 pm. Lunch (pizza) will be provided. 

This is a *mandatory* class and we will be covering some of the careers *requirements for graduation*. 

Please let me know if you have any questions!
<!channel> Mocktail on the 5th floor now! Come practice networking! :wink:
<!channel> Also hope to see you all tonight at the Mocktail event happening on the 5th floor - come and get in some networking practice!

<!channel> Reminder that on this magical day of days, there is not just one but TWO hiring talks!! *Capital One* will be coming to talk about their data science roles from *12 - 1 pm in the Speakeasy.*

Then, at the Data Science Meetup, at *3 pm in the Boardroom*, we will have a visit from *UnifyID*, which has hired our grads in the past, to talk about their AI fellowship.

See you all there!

<!channel> Hey everyone! I'm feeling under the weather today and am working from home. I'm cancelling my office hours today, but am adding some additional 1:1 times for calls on Friday. Sign up here! <https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Dchb4KmnBEc96QsKxiOFd5OZgQrx2mLQTpVVZ8Emvk/edit>

<!channel> Hey everyone! In case you're curious about who is coming to your Capstone Presentations next week, here are your panelists:

*Lance Barnett - Data Scientist @Asana*

Lance has a PhD in Mathematics and worked for many years in finance. But most of his work was managerial - so he came to Galvanize (Zipfian at the time) to make a career change. He learned a ton and graduated as part of Cohort 2! Now Lance works as a Data Scientist at Asana. He is part of a growing team of 8 and works with various product teams to set up metrics and design experiments. He uses SQL, Python and Spark on a daily basis.

*Rachel Thomas - Founder & Deep Learning Researcher @fast.ai*

Rachel Thomas is co-founder of <http://fast.ai|fast.ai>, a deep learning researcher, and a researcher-in-residence at University of San Francisco Data Institute, where she teaches in the Masters in Analytics program. Rachel has a math PhD from Duke and has previously worked as a quant, a data scientist + backend engineer at Uber, and a full-stack software instructor at Hackbright. Her writing has made the front page of Hacker News 4x, the top 5 list on medium, and been translated into Chinese, Spanish, & Portuguese. She is on twitter @math_rachel.

*Nathaniel Tucker - Researcher @Vicarious AI*

Nathaniel earned his AB/SM in Computer Science from Harvard. He Previously worked as a Quant and Trader at Jane Street and Goldman Sachs before transitioning into the pure tech industry. Nathaniel worked as a Data Scientist at Facebook, a Product Manager at Microsoft and a Software Engineer at Google before joining Vicarious. He is an avid reader, learner and teacher and teaches part time at General Assembly and is developing open source teaching material for data science, machine learning and web development on his [YouTube Channel](<https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQTQ0AbOupKNxKKY-_x46OQ>). 

*David von Dollen - Data Scientist @Audi*

As a Data Scientist, David Von Dollen has built recommender systems and tuned search engines for large e-commerce websites, implemented algorithms to predict customer churn and workplace injuries for insurance companies, developed AI systems for perception and contextual awareness, and optimized traffic flows leveraging quantum computing for large automotive companies.  He delights in bringing value back to businesses by augmenting decisions and processes with machine learning and data science.

<!channel> Capital One hiring talk on *Thurs. May 18th 12pm-1pm* in the Speakeasy! Their Director, Data Science - Andy Mahdavi - will be representing their current data science hiring needs in SF (multiple roles!).

<!channel> Office hours for this week: 
<https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?src=galvanize.com_4dgcak36o6a8au6kic4hdie8q0%40group.calendar.google.com&ctz=America/Los_Angeles>

And you can sign up for 1:1 calls on Friday here:
<https://docs.google.com/document/d/16Dchb4KmnBEc96QsKxiOFd5OZgQrx2mLQTpVVZ8Emvk/edit?usp=sharing>
I liked one of the comments: "Sooo??? You're looking for a pat on the back for not being... superficial?" :joy:

<!channel> FREE TICKETS to this Careers in Tech Recruiter Panel happening this week: <https://www.eventbrite.com/e/careers-in-tech-recruiter-panel-career-fair-and-mixer-tickets-33856385360>

Use promo code: gvpromo17

Let me know if it doesn't work!

definitely! maybe there's signal to what was previously considered noise now that we know people who interview by the usual good metrics aren't particularly better or worse than those who are brought in by their credentials alone.
I hope they figure out how to reconcile that.  I guess the bet bet to get across is our energy and honesty.

mcohenmcohen:  i wonder how that'll pan out. my friends who've worked in hiring and people analytics at google have said that our usual metrics for hiring usually are terrible indicators for future success

messages.text:
Tell me about yourself.
Tell me about a project.
Why are you interested in this position?
Tell me about your work experience.
Tell me about your education.
Why did you decide on a career/degree in _________?
Why did you/are you making a career change?
Why are you leaving your current job?
What did you like most/least about each of your jobs?
What kind of supervisor do you like to work for?
What are your strengths?
What are your weaknesses?
Tell me about a time you failed at something.
What 3 words would your coworkers use to describe you?
What 3 words would your current supervisor use to describe you?
If you had to describe your professional self in 3 words or phrases, which ones would you use?
Tell me about a time when you had to manage multiple priorities.
Tell me about a time when you worked on a team that didn’t work well together. OR Tell me about a time you didn’t get along with a coworker.
Tell me about your biggest professional challenge.
Tell me about a time when you were in a leadership role.
Why should we hire you?
Do you have any questions for me?

<!channel> Hello, lovely people! I hope you are all enjoying the Capstone work. I wanted to let you know that your Talent profiles will be due on *Monday, May 22nd, by 5 pm.* This is a hard deadline because after this, your profiles will be sent to everyone who is attending capstone presentations.

Before you publish your profile, you must include your capstone project, linked to Github, with a beautiful description of your project that will make everyone want to hire you. :wink:

Please *reach out and let me know* if you have any questions about completing your profiles. 

A completed Talent profile is a *requirement for graduation.*

<!channel> Hey everyone, I've had some requests for 1:1 time. In general, my office hours are times for dropping in and 1:1 isn't guaranteed. Hoping to see you at office hours, but if they don't work out for you, I've also created time slots for this Friday to talk 1:1 -- <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1vV35MmpQhtx4PO777sIL_Rrp6Sy_l6W1fALqeBQFeBg/edit?usp=sharing>

If none of these times work out for you and you would still like to talk, please get in touch on Slack and we can arrange something! :smile:
<!channel> Here are office hours for this week: <https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?src=galvanize.com_4dgcak36o6a8au6kic4hdie8q0%40group.calendar.google.com&ctz=America/Los_Angeles>

That first link is super helpful. Oh my gosh. I've had some awkward conversations with companies that later offered me a position because I made some outlandish (to them) suggestions...

<!channel> Good read on how to tell compelling stories - keep this in mind in particular for when you are talking about what motivated you to make the switch into data science! <https://medium.com/the-mission/the-stinky-cow-principle-how-to-tell-stories-that-make-people-trust-you-c40cdbb1ca4c>

attachments.title: The Stinky Cow Principle: How to Tell Stories that Make People Trust You
attachments.text: Details—even the gory ones—make you more likable.
attachments.fallback: Medium: The Stinky Cow Principle: How to Tell Stories that Make People Trust You

messages.text:
There are also a lot of good resources listed here:
<https://www.quora.com/What-are-some-good-resources-to-practice-SQL-for-a-data-science-interview>

In general I always suggest focusing on SELECT statements (inserts, updates and deletes are rare in DS). If you know backwards and forwards:

SELECT, JOIN(s), WHERE, GROUP BY, HAVING, subqueries, WITH, WINDOW 

that should cover almost everything. A lot of practice SQL problems may get into other areas, but ignoring things that aren't based on a SELECT is probably safe in most cases.
And then for specific interview practice SQL:

attachments.title: SQLCourse - Interactive Online SQL Training for Beginners
attachments.text: <http://SQLCourse.com|SQLCourse.com>: an interactive online training course for SQL beginners.
attachments.fallback: SQLCourse - Interactive Online SQL Training for Beginners
